title: A sum-product estimate in finite fields, and applications
desc: Let A be a subset of a finite field $F := Z/qZ$ for some prime q. If |F|δ<|A|<|F|1−δ for some δ>0, then we prove the estimate $|A+A| + |A.A| geq c(delta) |A|^{1+eps}$ for some $eps = eps(delta) > 0$. This is a finite field analogue of a result of Erdos and Szemeredi. We then use this estimate to prove a Szemeredi-Trotter type theorem in finite fields, and obtain a new estimate for the Erdos distance problem in finite fields, as well as the three-dimensional Kakeya problem in finite fields.

title: Multi-linear operators given by singular multipliers
desc: We prove L^p estimates for a large class of multi-linear operators, which includes the multi-linear paraproducts studied by Coifman and Meyer, as well as the bilinear Hilbert transform.

title: Robust Uncertainty Principles: Exact Signal Reconstruction from Highly Incomplete Frequency Information
desc: This paper considers the model problem of reconstructing an object from incomplete frequency samples. Consider a discrete-time signal $f in C^N$ and a randomly chosen set of frequencies Omega of mean size tauN. Is it possible to reconstruct f from the partial knowledge of its Fourier coefficients on the set Omega.
